response: "{ \"title\": \"Hard: Matrix Rotation\", \"description\": \"Given a square matrix, rotate the matrix 90 degrees clockwise. Write a function `rotate_matrix` that modifies the input matrix in-place to achieve this.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef rotate_matrix(matrix: List[List[int]]) -> None:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `matrix` (List[List[int]]): A 2D list of integers representing a square matrix.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Modifies the input matrix in-place to rotate it 90 degrees clockwise. The function should not return anything.\", \"code\": \"from typing import List\\n\\ndef rotate_matrix(matrix: List[List[int]]) -> None:\\n    n = len(matrix)\\n\\n    # Transpose the matrix\\n    for i in range(n):\\n        for j in range(i, n):\\n            matrix[j][i], matrix[i][j] = matrix[i][j], matrix[j][i]\\n\\n    # Reverse each row\\n    for i in range(n):\\n        matrix[i].reverse()\", \"tests\": [\"matrix = [[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6], [7, 8, 9]]; rotate_matrix(matrix); assert matrix == [[7, 4, 1], [8, 5, 2], [9, 6, 3]]\", \"matrix = [[5, 1], [2, 4]]; rotate_matrix(matrix); assert matrix == [[2, 5], [4, 1]]\"] }"
